snippet: More stringent postcrisis rules have decreased risk in money market mutual funds, but they have not completely assuaged regulators’ worries.
abstract: Regulators remain concerned with money market mutual funds despite adoption of more stringent rules in wake of financial crisis; funds hold more than $2.6 trillion in assets.
lead_paragraph: More stringent postcrisis rules have decreased risk in money market mutual funds, but they have not completely assuaged regulators’ worries.

headline.main: Money Funds Remain Haunted by Fears of ‘Breaking the Buck’
headline.print_headline: Money Funds Remain Haunted by Fears of ‘Breaking the Buck’
